title: Power Platform from the perspective of BC Development
description:
Power Platform made its place in the world. It solves many problems, and yet, the BC world still has a hard time adopting it.
Let's forget for a moment the ‚ÄúWhy don't you use AI?‚Äù discussions and return to the ‚ÄúWhy don't you use Power Platform?‚Äù topic.
You can hear many arguments for or against it. The price, skills needed, dev ops practices, source control, maintainability... Some are valid, and some are not anymore. Well, here's a session that's going to structure them.
This is not a session where we rant on Power Platform. This is a session where we help the PP audience understand why we're not hearing their message, and a session for the BC partners, trying to venture in the world of PP, so they know what they can expect. Join in, to learn Power Platform's place in the world of BC!

Speakers: waldo & Tine Stariƒç
Moderator: Gert Hector (ps. yes he had a cold)

title: From OpenAPI to AL Auto Generating Strongly Typed REST API Clients for BC with Kiota
description:
üí°Manually stitching together HttpClient, parsing JSON, and mapping records is yesterday‚Äôs game. üí°

In this Areopa Academy webinar, Microsoft MVP Tobias Fenster and Simon Fischer show how the open-source Kiota project can turn any OpenAPI specification into a fully typed AL extension ‚Äî slashing boilerplate, reducing bugs, and making integrations first-class citizens in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central.

üöÄ What you‚Äôll learn
‚Ä¢ Kiota 101 ‚Äì the language-agnostic generator Microsoft uses for Graph, now extended to AL.
‚Ä¢ Under the hood ‚Äì how the new AL generator plugs into Kiota with minimal core changes.
‚Ä¢ Runtime bundle ‚Äì a quick tour of the Kiota.Abstractions-al app that handles auth, errors, and JSON in BC.
‚Ä¢ Live demo ‚Äì generating a client from an OpenAPI definition and calling it from AL in a couple of minutes.
‚Ä¢ Path to production ‚Äì testing, CI, and contributing to the upstream PR.
Whether you‚Äôre an ISV, partner developer, or architect tired of cut-and-paste code, join us to see how you can focus on business logic, not boilerplate‚Äîand how you can help push this OSS effort across the finish line.

title: Sustainability functionality in Business Central What's there and why
description:
Sustainability is an important component of corporate strategy across multiple industries. This session explores the sustainability functionality within Business Central, and is intended mainly for Business Central functional consultants. You do not need to be familiar with sustainability terms, concepts, or regulations.

We will start by exploring the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind sustainability, focusing on the growing regulatory requirements and the importance of Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) reporting. We will then cover the ‚Äúwhat‚Äù - the current sustainability features available in Business Central, including Greenhouse Gas (GHG) emissions tracking, the Chart of Sustainability Accounts, and how you could approach sustainability reporting.

Finally, we will look ahead to upcoming Business Central features, and to trends that will impact sustainability management in Business Central.

This session aims to give you the knowledge to help your customers to get the most out of Business Central sustainability functionality.

Presenter: Niall McGovern
Editing: Mats Thell

title: Lessons learned from using Power Automate approvals with Business Central
description:
It's quite easy setting up Power Automate approvals to work with Business Central. However, after the initial setup there are quite some pitfalls and you may find yourself wrestling with unexpected behavior.
This session will discuss various lessons learned from implementing Power Automate approvals with Business Central. We will discuss the proper way of canceling approval requests, monitoring progress, exception handling and maintaining and upgrading existing approval flows. Combined with many demos this session will give you a lot of take-aways that can be applied immediately in your daily work.

title: Scrum, Stoicism, and Systems Thinking Finding Order in Complexity
description:
20250428 - Scrum, Stoicism, and Systems Thinking: Finding Order in Complexity

How do we navigate complexity and find clarity in challenging projects? This session dives into the synergy between Scrum, Stoicism, and Systems Thinking to uncover a framework for overcoming obstacles and driving success in Business Central implementations. Explore how Stoic virtues like wisdom and discipline align with Scrum principles such as adaptability and focus. Learn how Systems Thinking helps manage interconnected processes and dependencies in ERP systems. By blending philosophy, agile practices, and technical expertise, this session offers actionable insights to bring order to even the most complex projects.

title: How to be a Prompt Engineer
description:
Do you want to know what my first experience with generative AI was? Wildly inconsistent results. Half the time, the response wasn‚Äôt in JSON so I could parse it, and when it did work, it was slow. The problem? My prompts were bad. So, I started figuring out how to make them better.

What structure works best? How to determine the best temperature level? Should I care about function calling? Will my prompts perform well with 100 users?

The more I figured out how to use generative AI, the more I realized I was becoming a ‚Äúprompt engineer‚Äù. You know, the thing that‚Äôs supposed to replace all developers in the future. I‚Äôm not sure about that. But in the AI era, we need to know how to work with it.

If you‚Äôd like to skip all the trial-and-error steps, join this session to learn how to take your prompts from a simple request that returns wildly inconsistent results to a complex prompt that makes your new AI features more stable and reliable.

title: Elastic Leadership applied for Development Teams
description:
Join us for a concise, yet insightful session on ‚ÄúElastic Leadership applied for Development Teams‚Äù. In this rapidly changing technological landscape, leading technical teams requires a unique set of skills and approaches. This talk aims to provide leaders and managers with the essential tools needed to navigate the complexities of the tech industry and guide their teams towards successful projects.
 
Talk Highlights:

‚Ä¢ Understanding Elastic Leadership: Get a quick overview of the Elastic Leadership model developed by Roy Osherove and its application in the context of technical teams. Learn how to identify the phase your team is in and adapt your leadership style accordingly.
‚Ä¢ Adapting to Change and Uncertainty: Understand the importance of flexibility and adaptability in leadership. Discover methods for leading teams through periods of change and uncertainty in the tech industry. Learn to distinguish between technical and organizational problems to address them appropriately.
‚Ä¢ Sharing Insights: Learn from real-life examples for addressing common challenges faced by technical leaders.
 
Who Should Attend:
 
This talk is ideal for development team leaders, engineering managers, product owners, software architects, scrum masters, project managers, and anyone aspiring to lead development teams effectively.
 
Benefits:
 
‚Ä¢ Gain insights into leadership approaches tailored to the unique challenges of development teams.
‚Ä¢ Learn how to avoid team demotivation by applying the right leadership approach for the current phase your team is in.
‚Ä¢ Enhance your ability to lead teams through technological transformations.
‚Ä¢ Develop personal leadership skills that can advance your career
 
Join us for this session that combines theory with practical insights, ensuring you leave with actionable strategies to elevate your leadership skills in the ever-evolving world of technology.

title: Grabbing BC artifacts in your pipelines via an Azure Function and how all of this works
description:
If you have worked with BC containers, you probably know that Microsoft provides the required artifacts through PowerShell cmdlets. But there is a more elegant way: Through the BC artifact URL proxy, a simple HTTP request is enough and to make it even easier for your pipeline runs, there is now also an Azure DevOps extension utilizing the proxy. In this session, the creators Arthur and Tobias will show you how all of that works, how you can incorporate it in your pipeline and how development (with a devcontainer / Github Codespace) and operations (with a containerized Azure Function) are set up.

title: It is not C#, it is AL. Object oriented development in AL.
description:
Ever felt pressured to align your AL development with C# practices? How often have you heard, "That's how object-oriented development is done in C#, we should do the same"? There is nothing wrong with copying useful patterns from other languages, but here is the twist: are these developers really talking about objects or just classes? Many assume they are the same, but the reality is, the original concept of OOP tells a different story. You do not need classes for object-oriented development. Join my session to learn about origins of OOP and how we can use it to write better AL code.

title: Creating high performance low-code workflows for BC what's new in Azure Log
description:
One of the common requirements in Dynamics 365 Business Central projects is to efficiently handle integrations between systems, to handle complex processing of documents or complex message orchestrations and to overcome the operation limits of Business Central APIs. Low-code approaches for creating such workflows are often one of the first technical choices for Business Central partners. But partners that start in the wrong way (for example abusing of Power Automate) quite immediately run into a variety of problems such as poor performances, scalability, and unsatisfactory throughput for handling their processes. How to solve these common problems?
Azure Logic Apps provide a way to simplify and implement scalable integrations and workflows in the cloud. In this session we'll go in depth into the new Azure Logic Apps Standard platform and we'll see how to use a set of new features (currently in preview) for creating high performance low-code workflows for Dynamics 365 Business Central. We'll see how we can use Visual Studio Code for designing our stateless and stateful workflows, how to inject custom .NET code in actions where performances are poor, how to efficiently handle large batch data processing and how to design workflows for high throughput.
This session will change the way you will design your Business Central future integrations! It will show you lots of new and upcoming features and it will provide tips and real-world scenarios for creating workflows that flies.

title: Efficient testing with test doubles
description:
Most of developers have probably heard of the term ‚Äúmock‚Äù ‚Äì a kind of object that you use in your automated tests to represent some other object. However, this is probably where all knowledge about ‚Äúmocks‚Äù ends for you ‚Äì if you are like most other AL developers, you have never written a ‚Äúmock‚Äù, you have never used one, and very likely you don‚Äôt know that ‚Äúmock‚Äù is just one of five types of test doubles.
Test doubles are one of the most important and most powerful tools in any developer‚Äôs toolbox: they allow writing efficient, fast performing, focused tests that require less setup and put less stress on the system.
This webinar will present five different types of test doubles: dummies, spies, stubs, fakes, and mocks. You will see these doubles in action in real-life test code, and you will see how each of them helps you in its own right.
After this webinar, you‚Äôll be able to identify situations in which to use each of these different test doubles and how to write them. In the end, this will make your tests better.

title: Setting up and processing sales and use tax in Microsoft Dynamics 365 BC
description:

Setting up and processing sales and use tax in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

Abstract

title: Business Central's user interface is changing - align your app
description:
The latest release of Business Central introduced the "Modern Action Bar" ‚Äì a new way to present Actions to the user. Also, some time ago (April 2019) "views" were introduced as the new way to create different, predefined settings for existing List Pages. Until now, the application also presents 'legacy views' based on actions and cues from your role center, but soon these will no longer be added to List Pages - and already customers can opt in to this new behavior of the application.
Both changes require you to modernize your apps and start using the new features.
In this webinar, we'll show you how. In that journey, we'll also encounter a few changes that are (almost) unnoticeable to end users but make your developers' lives easier.

title: Test Automation is a team effort
description:
My experience is that test automation is often seen as a technical exercise: it is the developers who should be involved in this. A big misconception in my opinion. After all, just like the implementation of requirements, it is a team effort, with both a functional and a technical component, which are inextricably linked. In my session I want to highlight this and exchange ideas with the participants about the consequences. And be assured you get both your technical and non-technical colleagues attending.

title: DevOps and Docker in real life
description:
Most modern development tools, Docker and DevOps have found their way into the product development processes of Business Central partners, but development for Dynamics 365 Business Central is not only product development!

DevOps processes and Docker can also be helpful in streamlining development and publishing processes in customer, PTE and on-premise projects. However, questions often arise and myths circulate.
Can I use DevOps in on-premise environments, even when it‚Äôs not accessible from outside? How can I involve my customer or process owner in the release process? How do I manage dependencies from 3rd parties in DevOps processes? I need data, so how can I move my development to Docker containers? 

In this webinar we would like to give an overview of the possibilities of using DevOps & Docker in classic customer projects (PTE & on-premise) and present some use cases how release processes can be automated and centrally controlled.

title: Source Control and Audit Trail in Business Central
description:
Code in modern developments for Business Central is usually under source control and older versions can be retrieved on demand. However, in customers‚Äô production systems, both code, in the form of extensions, and data are often deleted or overwritten - either by mistake or when the system is updated.

Other problems include:
‚Ä¢ Inaccessible code - because Show My Code is, by default, set to false, customers can experience problems if the partner goes bankrupt or there is a dispute. 
‚Ä¢ Microsoft depreciating features - extensions become incompatible and eventually customers can‚Äôt access the functionality and the data it represents.
‚Ä¢ Code becoming too complex to maintain ‚Äì customers can‚Äôt monitor the quality of their code. 
‚Ä¢ The open platform of Business Central ‚Äì makes it easy to change code and data without anybody knowing and without any trail, opening the door to fraud.

This webinar discusses these issues and demonstrates the solution we have created for Business Central to address them.

Presenter: Michael Nielsen
Moderator: Luc van Vugt

description:
Three years and three names later, Microsoft Dataverse is here to stay.
Adopted from Dynamics CRM and integrated with Power Apps, this ‚Äúit‚Äôs more than a database‚Äù is a vital part of the Power Platform and Dynamics 365 applications.
Finally the shape of an integrated business applications platform is emerging, slowly leaving behind the confusion with the rebranding and introduction of Dynamics 365 in November 2017.
Now what is Microsoft Dataverse and why should we, the ERP people, care about it?
The bottom line: What‚Äôs in it for us?

And what are different scenarios and how do they compare? The Azure pricing calculator might help, but it becomes tedious to use in more complex scenarios, so in this session you will see how you can use the pricing API, a command line tool and Excel to make your life easier.

description:
Your old C/AL add-on is now rebuild app on AppSource after your team has done a super human effort. Learning AL, working out an event based architecture, and many more like, for many totally new, getting test automation in place.
But how are going to continue this more efficient with your next enhancements?
In this session I would like to share my thoughts on how to get all disciplines (better) facing the same direction with behaviour based requirements specifications.

For those how missed Luc's presentation at Directions this is great chance to get in the know of his story.
And for those who did follow: grab you chance as Luc will have some more time to elaborate on his story and will add some new things too.

title: Learning BC Development from Scratch - How Do You Get Started
description:
Steve Endow is a Microsoft MVP who has worked with Microsoft Dynamics GP for 16 years, but until recently, had never used NAV or BC.  He had programmed in VB, C#, and .NET for over 20 years, but he had never seen C/AL or AL code. 
 
2 years ago, Steve decided that it was time to invest in learning Dynamics 365 Business Central.  Join us for this webinar to hear about Steve's ongoing journey to learn the Business Central application and become a Business Central developer.

Speaker: Steve Endow 
Moderator: Luc van Vugt

title: How to develop VS Code Extensions
description:
In this webinar I'll start from scratch and will help you getting familiar with the development of VS Code Extensions. We will set up a new environment and create our first VSIX. While doing that, I will show you how we can interact with other visual studio extensions and how we can use the commands of visual studio code itself to develop even better extensions.

Speaker: David Feldhoff
Moderator: Luc van Vugt

title: How to sync master data in multiple companies using Power Automate
description:
Master data synchronization between multiple BC companies when done manually can be painful for users! There are of course other options and in this session I want to talk about one of those; Power Automate. During the session you will see how one chosen company is responsible for data being inserted, modified or deleted in other companies. Many different pieces of master data could be handled whether it be the Chart of Accounts, Customers or Items. Opportunity to see how the Power Platform can help solve a common business applications issue in the low/no code format.

Speaker: Josh Anglesea
Moderator: Luc van Vugt

title: Test, a team effort!
description:
To bring your apps to AppSource, they have to pass the technical validation. Microsoft applies code coverage based on automatic testing.
However, what does this say about quality? How do you make sure you make good tests? Do you cover the risks? And is this the only way to test?
At Schouw Informatisering, testing is a separate process that is monitored by the Test Coordinator. Olaf Jorritsma takes you through the process, the test scripts, tools and the Definition of Done.
Testing is woven into the overall process, is a team effort and ensures focus on features instead of bugs.

Speaker: Olaf Jorritsma
Moderator: Luc van Vugt

4:06 Introduction
04:54  Why Test
08:18  Test Process
13:45  The Approach & Tools
38:06  Testing Lessons Learned

title: Enums in Business Central
description:
For decades we used options to give the user the predefined list of choices. It was simple, but very ‚Äúhardcoded‚Äù. Business Central gives us a better ‚Äúoption‚Äù for the options: enums. And in Business Central 16 Microsoft replaced most of the old options by enums. In this session you will get the general overview about new ‚Äúoption-on-steroids‚Äù type, how to use it and how to manage v16 shift.

Speaker: Dmitry Katson
Moderator: Luc van Vugt

Note: all code examples can be found in this github repository: https://github.com/dkatson/BC-Enums-Webinar-07-07-20

title: Automating and extending Azure DevOps
description:
Probably most of the technical people in the BC universe know by now how to automate CI/CD with Azure DevOps. But how do you automate and extend Azure DevOps? This session will show you how to set up new projects, handle the technical as well as functional aspects and also how to extend Azure DevOps with your own functionality. If you look for ways how to standardize and ease the usage of Azure DevOps in your company, this session will show you the way.
 
Presenter: Tobias Fenster
Moderator: Luc van Vugt

title: Preparing your BC upgrade ‚Äì A panel discussion
description:
In moving our (clients) solutions from Dynamics NAV to Dynamics 365 Business Central and from C/SIDE to VSCode quite a number of steps need to be taken as discussed by, for example, Luc van Vugt in his January 28, 2020 Areopa webinar and Jon Long in his April 14, 2020 Areopa webinar.
In this webinar, after an introduction by the presenters, Jon, Saurav and Luc will discuss the preparatory steps, including licensing, that have to be taken. The audience is invited to step in with their thoughts and questions and might send their thoughts and questions up-front to webinars@areopa.academy.

Presenters/Panelists
 ‚Ä¢ Jon Long
 ‚Ä¢ Saurav Dhyani
 ‚Ä¢ Luc van Vugt

title: Interfaces in AL
description:
With Business Central 2020 release wave 1 we get a new language feature in AL: Interfaces. In this webinar you will get a bit of background why that is a very important addition to the toolset of Business Central developers and architects and see a practical demo of how to use interfaces

Presenter: Tobias Fenster
Moderator: Luc van Vugt

title: What's new in Business Central 2020 Wave 1 YouTube
description:
The new release for Business Central comes with a number of technical improvements and new features. In this webinar Eric Wauters (aka "Waldo") and Arend-Jan Kauffmann will discuss the most important topics. It will be challenging to cover all topics in just one hour, but we will try to squeeze in as much as possible!

Speakers: Eric Wauters & Arend-Jan Kauffmann 
Moderator: Luc van Vugt

title: Get Current/Stay Current - Aligning Your Dynamics Upgrade Strategy to Microsoft
description:
Join Jon to learn how Microsoft has changed the way we think of upgrades, and learn what to expect in the journey to get on the latest version of Business Central
‚Ä¢ Understand best practices in upgrading customizations 
‚Ä¢ Get points on formulating a strategy for staying current

Presenters: Jon Long, ArcherPoint
Moderator: Luc van Vugt

title: Our road to SaaS @ Schouw Informatisering
description:
Schouw Informatisering was a partner like many others: a combination of ISV and VAR. With the arrival of Business Central and AppSource, they have made the choice to focus on one business model: that of ISV. Danny Hellemons likes to share the experiences and challenges that came with it. How do you approach DevOps, not just as a tool but especially as a process in which everyone is involved? And faced with choices, such as the product portfolio: are you going to do purely Business Central or also get started with the Microsoft products around it such as the Power Platform?
Additinally, you have to get the organization ready to take the first steps and then keep it up to date. Just see all the information at a glance, that's quite a challenge! And eventually it all has to end up on AppSource. How do you get your first product on it and then?

Presenter: Danny Hellemons
Moderator: Luc van Vugt

title: Our road to SaaS @ Clever Dynamics
description:
In this session Clever Dynamics Ltd. Managing Director and Product Manager James Crowter and James Pearson will take us back on their road to Business Central. How moving to SaaS changed their whole way of running their business and will share their learnings with us.

Presenters: James Crowter & James Pearson
Moderator: David Singleton

title: Take a look over the wall - D365 FO for BC pros
description:
The latest version of Dynamics AX or Axapta is nowadays called Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Finance & Operations. In this session you will get to know D365 FO through a few facets of the finance section and we show how Microsoft approaches the roll-out and support, and we also highlight some architectural and technical differences with Business Central.

Presenters: Ludo Van den Ende & Johan Knops
Moderator: Luc van Vugt

title: Upgrade to BC - How do you do that
description:
How do you get a NAV installation upgraded to Business Central? There are quite a few colors and flavors that you have to take into account. What if you only have C/AL code? What if you stay on prem? Or do you want to go to the cloud? And yes, there was always lack of clear tooling from MS. So what about actually? With these, and more, questions, Luc van Vugt went to investigate himself. During these sessions he presents his findings and is also looking forward to involvement from the audience.

Speaker & Moderator: Luc van Vugt

PS: apology for the not optimal sound quality

title: Dynamically scaling BC containers on Docker Swarm using Azure SQL
description:
The usage of Docker containers for Business Central development and test environments has become a vital part for a lot of partners and end-users. In the webinar on Oct 1st, we have seen how we can solve the networking challenges that come up when moving from a locally running container to a central Docker host. However, this is not the end of the road. If you need more flexible and scalable environments where you combine the resources of multiple virtual machines, Docker Swarm is an easy to setup, Windows-only option. And the answer for on-demand highly scalable SQL is of course Azure SQL. In this session, you will see how you can combine those two technologies to create a Business Central container environment that can on demand provide whatever resources you need.

Please note that a lot of the same ground was covered in the TechDays session "Make the most out of Business Central containers"

Speaker: Tobias Fenster | tobias.fenster@cosmoconsult.com
Moderator: David Singleton

title: Working with APIs
description:
Business Central comes with a lot of API's out of the box. Do you know how to use them? And what about creating your own API's? During this session we will explore the possibilities and show how to take control over API's. And of course we will dig deeper and look at features of API's that are not so well-known. Be prepared for a fully packed session with a lot of information!

Speaker: Arend-Jan Kauffmann / aj@kauffmann.nl
Moderator: James Pearson

title: Control Events with the Discovery Event Pattern
description:
With the arrival of Events we have received a powerful means to separate our specific code from the business logic. But in addition to the advantages, in my experience there are also disadvantages to working with Events, especially if we as developers do not approach it in a structured way, and in particular in the Event Subscribers. Examples where these Event Subscribers may get in the way are during Data Upgrades, debugging and in the example that led me to this session; easy separation of code per company.
To solve my challenge I started working with the Discovery Event Pattern and realized that I am also offering solutions for other challenges related to Events. In this session we will look together at the objects with which we can offer users an interface to control the Event Subscribers and how the handling of the code shifts to the same Subscribers. We also briefly discuss other possible applications of this functionality, especially with look view to the future of Dynamics 365 Business Central.
                
Speaker: Martin Oomen
Moderator: Jascha Vincke and Luc van Vugt

Areopa webinars news letter http://eepurl.com/gHOJWf

Upcoming webinars are listed on
https://areopa.academy/

title: Azure Functions for Dynamics 365 Business Central developers
description:
Azure Functions is the serverless computing service hosted on the Microsoft Azure public cloud and it's actually the recommended way to execute .NET code in the cloud from Dynamics 365 Business Central.
In this webcast we'll see how to create Azure Functions, how to use them with Dynamics 365 Business Central and how to use your existing DLLs in the cloud, how to monitor a function and how to use Azure Functions efficiently on distributed environments (multiple tenants).

Speaker: Stefano Demiliani
Moderator: David Singleton

title: Running multiple NAV/BC containers on an Azure VM
description:
Freddy Kristiansen from Microsoft has created very convenient templates to create virtual machines on Azure  with NAV/BC containers by using links like https://aka.ms/getbc , filling in a bit of configuration and with that getting access to fully prepared dev/test/demo environments. But what if you want a second or more additional containers? Creating them and using them directly on the VM is no problem, again thanks to Freddy Kristiansen's navcontainerhelper, but if you want to access them from your laptop or somewhere else outside of the Azure VM, it gets a bit more complicated. In this webinar you will get an explanation of the technical background and also an easy way to work around that limitation and prepare Azure VMs for multiple containers conveniently as well. The same concept also applies to VMs on prem although there might be other solutions in that scenario, which will be briefly covered as well
 
Presenter: Tobias Fenster

title: What does it mean to 'build' an app for Business Central
description:
Why do I keep hearing about "CI/CD" and "pipelines" and is this something I should be doing?
In this session we'll cover what a build pipeline is and the benefits it can bring to your development process. We'll take a sample AL app, push it to a Git repository in Azure DevOps, create a simple YAML file that defines the build steps and run it on a hosted build agent. Sounds complicated? It isn't. You'll see how easy it is to start automating tasks to ensure the code that you ship to your customers is tested and consistent.

title: How to get Insights from Business Central without Excel
description:
Millions of people prefer Excel to get insights from data. Excel is very powerful in data transformations, filtering, sorting etc. but it's a one-time-get-insight-in-ui tool. And what if you need a repeatable solution? Yep. You can try to build pivot tables in AL. And what if you need to make pivot tables of pivot tables, together with data transformation, joining,  data construction etc. Try this in AL and send us your feedback :)
In this webinar, Dmitry Katson will show you an alternative modern way - Python Azure Functions. Combining data from Business Central with the world most popular open source programming language with serverless architecture will move your extensions to the TOP level. Guaranteed you will leave this webinar with the at least "What? That's really possible?" minds in your head:)

Presenter: Dmitry Katson

title: Getting easily from functional test case definitions to automated tests
description:
In his book "Automated Testing for Dynamics 365 Business Central" Dynamics NAV MVP Luc van Vugt learns you write automated tests for Dynamics NAV and Business Central. He briefly mentions a tool ATDD.TstScriptor, but did not go into it, as he and Jan Hoek were still working on it. Around the time the book was published the ATDD.TestScriptor was released on the PowerShell Gallery. In this webinar Luc will show you how ATDD.TestScriptor can help your team to setup functional test cases and easily transform them into a framework for your test automation.

Presenter: Luc van Vugt
Moderator: Jan Hoek

title: How I learned NAV in a few months
description:
The changes in the Dynamics 365 NAV/BC technology and distribution channel made Global Mediator (GM) rethink how to bring new developers into the channel. In this webinar, they will share their experience.
GM COO Nicolai Krarup will start by describing why the company decided to invest in new talent. Followed by GM Delivery Director Evgeny Buriak, who will describe the process developed to get talent up to speed. Finally GM developer Yuriy Popov will share his personal experience, having been through this whole process, supported by practical examples.
Presenters: Nicolai Krarup, Evgeny Buriak, Yuriy Popov
Moderator: Luc van Vugt
